meanings.definition: To talk impudently or disrespectfully to someone.
meanings.sent1: Stop sassing your teacher and show some respect.
meanings.sent2: She was sassing her parents and got grounded.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was sassing the visitors, mimicking their words in a cheeky manner.
meanings.sent4: The rebellious teenager couldn't help sassing authority figures at every opportunity.
meanings.sent5: The little boy was sassing his older sister, thinking he was being funny.

meanings.definition: The act of speaking impudently or disrespectfully to someone.
meanings.sent1: Her constant sassing towards her classmates made her unpopular.
meanings.sent2: I can't stand his constant sassing; it's so rude.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's sassing of the audience had everyone laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The politician's clever sassing of his opponent won over the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to address the student's sassing in front of the whole class.
